title: French Far-Left Calls For Macron's Resignation After No-Confidence Vote
content: France's hard left on Wednesday urged President Emmanuel Macron to resign and hold early presidential elections after lawmakers voted to oust the government of Prime Minister Michel Barnier.
summary: France's hard left on Wednesday urged President Emmanuel Macron to resign and hold early presidential elections after lawmakers voted to oust the government of Prime Minister Michel Barnier.

title: 700 Bangladeshi Terrorists, Death Row Convicts Still On Run After Jailbreak
content: Around 700 Bangladeshi prison inmates were still on the run after mass jailbreaks over the summer during the student-led revolution that ousted autocratic ex-prime minister Sheikh Hasina, authorities said Wednesday.
summary: Around 700 Bangladeshi prison inmates were still on the run after mass jailbreaks over the summer during the student-led revolution that ousted autocratic ex-prime minister Sheikh Hasina, authorities said Wednesday.

title: French Lawmakers Oust PM Michel Barnier In No-Confidence Vote
content: French lawmakers on Wednesday voted to oust the government of Prime Minister Michel Barnier after just three months in office in a move which deepens a political crisis in the country.
summary: French lawmakers on Wednesday voted to oust the government of Prime Minister Michel Barnier after just three months in office in a move which deepens a political crisis in the country.

title: 'Martial Law' Most-Searched Word On Google In South Korea
content: The Korean term for "martial law" was the most-searched word on Google in South Korea on Wednesday, following President Yoon Suk Yeol's short-lived declaration of martial law.
summary: The Korean term for "martial law" was the most-searched word on Google in South Korea on Wednesday, following President Yoon Suk Yeol's short-lived declaration of martial law.

title: PM Modi One Of The Wisest Persons In World, Says Kuwait Foreign Minister
content: Calling India a "very important partner", Kuwait's Foreign Minister Abdullah Ali Al-Yahya on Wednesday heaped praise on Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
summary: Calling India a "very important partner", Kuwait's Foreign Minister Abdullah Ali Al-Yahya on Wednesday heaped praise on Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Hamas Threatens To "Neutralise" Hostages If Israel Conducts Rescue Op
content: Hamas said it had information that Israel intended to carry out a hostage rescue operation similar to one conducted in Gaza's Nuseirat camp in June and threatened to "neutralise" the captives if any such action took place.
summary: Hamas said it had information that Israel intended to carry out a hostage rescue operation similar to one conducted in Gaza's Nuseirat camp in June and threatened to "neutralise" the captives if any such action took place.

title: Telegram Tackles Child Abuse Images After Founder's Arrest
content: Messaging app Telegram will deploy new tools to prevent the spread of images of child sexual abuse after teaming up with the Internet Watch Foundation (IWF), the UK-based charity said Wednesday.
summary: Messaging app Telegram will deploy new tools to prevent the spread of images of child sexual abuse after teaming up with the Internet Watch Foundation (IWF), the UK-based charity said Wednesday.

title: UK Bans Daytime TV Ads For Junk Food, Including Cereals, Muffins, Burgers
content: The UK government is banning daytime TV adverts for sugary foods like granola and muffins in its battle against child obesity, branding such popular items as junk food.
summary: The UK government is banning daytime TV adverts for sugary foods like granola and muffins in its battle against child obesity, branding such popular items as junk food.

title: Millions Of People In Cuba Without Power After Grid Collapse
content: Cuba said it had begun restoring power after the island's electrical grid collapsed, the latest in a string of nationwide blackouts that underscore the increasingly frail state of the country's power generation system.
summary: Cuba said it had begun restoring power after the island's electrical grid collapsed, the latest in a string of nationwide blackouts that underscore the increasingly frail state of the country's power generation system.

title: Israeli Settlers Raid West Bank Towns, Set Homes, Buildings On Fire
content: Israeli settlers on Wednesday wounded a Palestinian and set buildings on fire while raiding two villages in the occupied West Bank after a nearby settlement outpost was evicted by Israeli forces, Palestinian and Israeli sources said.
summary: Israeli settlers on Wednesday wounded a Palestinian and set buildings on fire while raiding two villages in the occupied West Bank after a nearby settlement outpost was evicted by Israeli forces, Palestinian and Israeli sources said.

title: OpenAI Chief Sam Altman Says Elon Musk Won't Abuse Government Power
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman expressed confidence Wednesday that Elon Musk would not use his proximity to Donald Trump to harm business rivals, calling such actions "profoundly un-American."
summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman expressed confidence Wednesday that Elon Musk would not use his proximity to Donald Trump to harm business rivals, calling such actions "profoundly un-American."

title: Iran Frees Nobel Winner Narges Mohammadi For 3 Weeks On Medical Grounds
content: Iranian authorities on Wednesday freed Nobel peace prize winner Narges Mohammadi from prison for three weeks on medical grounds, a move supporters decried as "too little too late" with the Nobel committee urging a permanent release.
summary: Iranian authorities on Wednesday freed Nobel peace prize winner Narges Mohammadi from prison for three weeks on medical grounds, a move supporters decried as "too little too late" with the Nobel committee urging a permanent release.

title: Trump Names Billionaire Private Astronaut Jared Isaacman As Next NASA Chief
content: US President-elect Donald Trump on Wednesday nominated Jared Isaacman, the online payments billionaire and the first private astronaut to ever perform a spacewalk, as the next head of NASA.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump on Wednesday nominated Jared Isaacman, the online payments billionaire and the first private astronaut to ever perform a spacewalk, as the next head of NASA.

title: Georgia Sinks In Chaos As Police Raid Opposition Offices
content: The protests have turned violent, with around 300 people detained and dozens injured in clashes between protesters and police, outside the parliament building in Tbilisi.
summary: The protests have turned violent, with around 300 people detained and dozens injured in clashes between protesters and police, outside the parliament building in Tbilisi.

title: Nepal Joins China's Belt And Road Initiative, Raises Concerns For New Delhi
content: A significant agreement was signed in Beijing today paving the way for China to make major inroads in Nepal.
summary: A significant agreement was signed in Beijing today paving the way for China to make major inroads in Nepal.

title: 108 Metre "Chunri" Offered To Temple As Nepal City Celebrates Ram-Sita Wedding
content: A Chunri measuring 108 meters has been offered to the Janaki Temple of Nepal by a trust from Surat (Gujarat, India) on the occasion of 'Bibah Panchami', marking the wedding of Lord Ram with Goddess Sita.
summary: A Chunri measuring 108 meters has been offered to the Janaki Temple of Nepal by a trust from Surat (Gujarat, India) on the occasion of 'Bibah Panchami', marking the wedding of Lord Ram with Goddess Sita.

title: UP Man Given Death Penalty In Saudi On Drug Charges, Family Pleads For Mercy
content: A court in Saudi Arabia has sentenced a man from Meerut in Uttar Pradesh to death on charges of drug trafficking, triggering panic and despair among his family members who have pleaded for clemency.
summary: A court in Saudi Arabia has sentenced a man from Meerut in Uttar Pradesh to death on charges of drug trafficking, triggering panic and despair among his family members who have pleaded for clemency.

title: United Healthcare CEO Brian Thompson Shot Dead In New York, Gunman At Large
content: Brian Thompson, 50, was shot in Manhattan just before 7 am at a hotel. The shooter fled the scene of the crime after the attack.
summary: Brian Thompson, 50, was shot in Manhattan just before 7 am at a hotel. The shooter fled the scene of the crime after the attack.

title: "Muhammad Yunus Involved In Genocide": Sheikh Hasina In 1st Public Address
content: Ousted Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has mounted a stinging attack on the country's interim leader Muhammad Yunus over alleged persecution of minorities.
summary: Ousted Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has mounted a stinging attack on the country's interim leader Muhammad Yunus over alleged persecution of minorities.

title: Man Trapped In Well For 3 Days As Villagers Mistake Cries For Ghost Sounds
content: It wasn't until police dispatched rescue personnel to the forest that they heard a voice responding to their calls.
summary: It wasn't until police dispatched rescue personnel to the forest that they heard a voice responding to their calls.
